alert.note: Alert for South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 3:46AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow showers and blowing snow will gradually diminish this morning. Additional accumulations will be less than 2 inches. Another round of snow will move into the mountains late tonight or early Sunday morning, and may become heavy at times Sunday afternoon with additional accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds will also strengthen with gusts greater 60 mph above timberline producing considerable blowing and drifting snow over the higher mountain passes. * WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from early Sunday morning through late Sunday night with the worst conditions expected Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to periods of heavy snow, blowing snow, and poor visibility. Roads will be slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you must travel during these times, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org
